title: How is planck mass derived? - Quora

response.answer_text: The same way as any other planck unit is derived, i.e by combining the 3 universal physical constants [math]c, \hbar[/math] and [math]G[/math] in suitable way so that it produces the dimension of mass. The right combination turns out to be [math]\sqrt{\frac{\hbar c}{G}}[/math] which in SI units is approximately equal to [math]2.176 \times 10^{-8} kg[/math].
